parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to an official campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "REPER," which is a political party participating in the parliamentary elections.  This directly refers to a candidate (or group of candidates) participating in the election, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post, being a paid Facebook advertisement, is clearly intended to reach a wide audience beyond personal communication.  The targeting parameters (age, location) further confirm this. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The phrase "Dâmbovița votează REPER pe 1 decembrie!" ("Dâmbovița votes REPER on December 1st!") has a clear electoral objective: to encourage voters in Dâmbovița County to vote for REPER in the parliamentary elections. This directly aims to influence the vote, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks any journalistic elements such as news reporting, analysis, or opinion pieces. It's a straightforward call to action, not an attempt at informing the public in a neutral manner.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for votes.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>486555060504441</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, a paid advertisement by REPER Dâmbovița, directly promotes the party in the context of the upcoming parliamentary elections. The message explicitly urges voters to support REPER.  While the ad doesn't contain a CMF number, the clear call to action, targeting of a specific region, and paid nature of the post strongly suggest it constitutes electoral propaganda. The post's objective is undeniably to influence the outcome of the election. The end date of the ad (1732867200, which corresponds to November 30th, 2024) is before the election day, but the post is still problematic because it is a paid advertisement that directly promotes a candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>REPER</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>REPER</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
REPER Dâmbovița, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 486555060504441), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu mesajul "Dâmbovița votează REPER pe 1 decembrie!",  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea partidului REPER.  Reclama, deși nu conține un număr CMF, îndeplinește toate criteriile propagandei electorale: se referă direct la un candidat (REPER), se adresează publicului larg din județul Dâmbovița, are un obiectiv electoral clar (influențarea votului) și depășește limitele activității jurnalistice.  Cheltuielile pentru reclamă au fost sub 100 RON, conform Ad Library,  ajungând la o estimare a audienței de 100.000-500.000 de persoane.  Datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile în Ad Library: steluta.munteanu@partidulreper.ro și +40720412010.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
